name: 東亞語言文化比較
goals: 認識各種語言在台灣歷史中的地位轉變
瞭解台灣多元文化的傳承與變遷，以殖民及移民的觀點瞭解台灣文化、語言、及文學
具有使用檔案、文獻、文本的能力，具有跨國或跨語言的比較能力
syllabus:
The aim of this course is to provide a comprehensive overview of the linguistic diversity in East Asia in relation to the cultural and historical specificities that characterize each of the countries under discussion. In the first half, the course load of texts will adapt an historical perspective, while the second half will include present-day language planning and cultural policy in East Asia.

In this course we will mainly read and study materials (primary and secondary) that are also known as missionary linguistics. We will cover the regions of Korea, China, Japan, Taiwan and these parts of Southeast-Asia where missionaries compiled dictionaries, glossaries and textbooks in Chinese dialects. Attention will be paid to the introduction of different orthographies, the role of the church in 19th century language standardization initiatives and programs, as well as the present-day legacy of missionary linguistics in East Asia. A brief comparison with topics in missionary linguistics beyond East Asian borders will provide the bigger picture. This course is taught in English.

This course will introduce a number of topics that cover language and culture in East Asia. The focus will be on the Chinese cultural sphere of influence, the Chinese diaspora in Southeast Asia, but also the legacies of colonialism and imperialism in the region. Reading skills in Asian languages and Indo-European languages are required. If desired, the practical aspect of the course may include a few lectures in digital humanities that introduce databases and tools for computational linguistics.
